smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams were found in the provided file.
All use cases in the 'Kasvuhoonete funktsionaalne allsüsteem' diagram (Page 2) are connected to at least one actor (Klient, Juhataja, Kasvuhoonete haldur, or Uudistaja).
No use cases with synonymous names associated with the same actor were found.
No distinct model elements with the same name were found within the same package.

Common column names like 'reg_aeg' or 'nimetus' appear in multiple tables (e.g., Isik, Kasvuhoone), but they represent distinct attributes for different entities, not redundant copies of the same data value.
Use case naming is consistent; all use cases on Page 2 start with a verb (e.g., Vaata, Tuvasta, Registreeri, Muuda).
In the state diagram (Page 11), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, etc.) are reachable from the start state.
All actions in the activity diagrams (Pages 3 and 4) are reachable via the defined decision flows.
Associations in the class diagrams (e.g., Page 5, 9, 10) define multiplicity at both ends (e.g., 1 to 0..*).
The use case diagram 'Kasvuhoonete funktsionaalne allsüsteem' on Page 2 contains 11 central elements (use cases), which exceeds the limit of fewer than 10.
No single class or table connects to 6 or more other elements on a single diagram. The maximum observed was 5 (e.g., Isik table on Page 13).
The layout of elements appears reasonably spaced without excessive distances between related elements.
On the activity diagram 'Kasvuhoone aktiveerimise tegevusdiagramm' (Page 4), the action 'Kasutaja näeb ebaõnnestumist' starts with 'Kasutaja' (User), which is a noun, not an active verb.
No class, table, attribute, or use case names were found to be 3 characters or less (excluding allowed abbreviations like 'id' within constraints).
All class names start with an uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., Isik, Kasvuhoone, Klient).
All attribute names start with a lowercase letter (e.g., eesnimi, perenimi, reg_aeg).
Database table names (Pages 13-18) are singular (e.g., Isik, Klient, Kasvuhoone).
No Hungarian notation or type prefixes (e.g., tbl_, str_) were found on element names. Prefixes like PK_ and FK_ are allowed exceptions.
